articles.author: Nate Raymond
articles.description: Democratic-led states that have vowed to challenge President-elect Donald Trump's initiatives will face a tough legal landscape after his first-term appointments reshaped the judiciary, not only giving the U.S. Supreme Court a conservative supermajority but also diluting liberal judges' influence on a key appeals court that often stymied his agenda.
articles.title: Democratic-led states could face tougher legal pathway to challenge Trump's policies

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A bomb hidden in an electric scooter killed a senior Russian general in charge of nuclear protection forces in Moscow on Tuesday, Russia's investigative committee said.
articles.title: Bomb kills chief of Russian nuclear protection forces in Moscow

articles.author: Brad Brooks, Joseph Ax
articles.description: Natalie Rupnow, a 15-year-old girl, opened fire in a classroom, fatally shooting a fellow student and a teacher and wounding six other people before killing herself with the handgun, police said.
articles.title: Teenage girl shoots dead fellow student and teacher at Wisconsin school

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: German and French officials are due to meet representatives of Syria's new governing authorities in Damascus on Tuesday, expanding Western contacts with the new administration after British diplomats met its leader Ahmed al-Sharaa late on Monday.
articles.title: Western governments expand contacts with Syria's new leadership

articles.author: Jean-Stéphane Brosse, Abdou Moustoifa
articles.description: Hundreds or even thousands could be dead in the wreckage of Cyclone Chido, officials said.
articles.title: Mayotte authorities fear hunger and disease; race to help cyclone survivors

articles.author: Mark Trevelyan
articles.description: Russian prosecutors have demanded prison terms of nearly six years each for three lawyers who represented Alexei Navalny, an ally of the late opposition leader said on Tuesday.
articles.title: Russian prosecutors seek jail terms of nearly six years for three of Navalny's lawyers

articles.author: David Ljunggren
articles.description: Chrystia Freeland quit after Prime Minister Justin Trudeau offered her a lesser position.
articles.title: Canada government adrift after finance minister resigns, Trump tariffs loom

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: South Korea's acting president Han Duck-soo on Tuesday called for next year's government budget to be swiftly implemented from the start of 2025 in order to help revive the country's slowing economy.
articles.title: South Korea acting president Han calls for speedy implementation of 2025 budget

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Across the globe in 2024, Reuters photographers took hundreds of thousands of images of our changing world - its daily life, its disaster zones, the U.S. campaign trails that light up the media every four years and the comet that lights up the sky every 80,000.
articles.title: Some of the best Reuters photos of 2024, and the stories behind them

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Philippines said it delivered provisions earlier this month to its military personnel stationed at features in the South China Sea that Manila occupies but are claimed by Beijing.
articles.title: Philippines sends provisions to military personnel in South China Sea
